programme.desc: England v India. Coverage of the third and final encounter in the three-match series, which takes place at the Brightside Ground in Bristol. programme.title: Live ANZ Premiership Netball
programme.desc: Magic v Steel (Centre-pass 8.40am). Coverage of the match from the 10th round of fixtures, taking place at Claudelands Arena in Hamilton, as New Zealand's top-flight competition continues. The Steel won 64-60 in May's reverse fixture in Dunedin and look set to challenge Central Pulse for the title, while the Magic will need to capitalise on their games in hand if they are to contend.

programme.title: Live Women's International One-Day Cricket
programme.sub-title: England v New Zealand: Second ODI
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Coverage of the second match of the three-match series, taking place at the 3aaa County Ground in Derby. England set a world record women's international T20 score against South Africa last month, just hours after New Zealand had set the record also against the Proteas. The Kiwis had recorded a score of 216-1 in a 66-run win over South Africa, before England then hit 250-3 on the same wicket, which included a knock of 116 off 52 balls by Tammy Beaumont.(n)

programme.title: Trijicon's World of Sports Afield
programme.sub-title: Alberta Bighorn, Trial by Fire Pt. 1
programme.desc: Part 1. Dan Catlin is in the Rocky Mountains of Alberta, guided by Kyle Shyback of Scalp Creek Outfitters. Getting a ram is just one step in this two-part adventure.

programme.title: Hornady's Dark & Dangerous
programme.desc: The Zambezi Valley is where Mitch Mittlestaedt joins PH Len Taylor on a hunt for cape buffalo. PH Keith Wall and Harry Fouke start a dangerous game combo hunt in the Lowveld. Finally, we join Trevor Prisk and PH Dean Kendall in Tanzania.

programme.title: Razor Dobbs Alive
programme.sub-title: 10mm Auto Pistol Warthog & Zebra in Africa
programme.desc: Razor Dobbs hunts zebra and warthog in Africa.

programme.title: The Ultimate Hunt
programme.desc: Former Army Captain Gary Bartels Jr. travels to Canada in pursuit of his first-ever black bear. Before heading home to the Lone Star State in pursuit of a giant whitetail.

programme.title: Under Wild Skies
programme.desc: Tony tours the Blaser Rifles factory in Isny, Germany and designs a custom Safari rifle. He uses it to shoot a Cape buffalo in the Timbavati Game Reserve with professional hunter Jacques Hartzenberg.

programme.title: Greg McHale's Wild Yukon
programme.sub-title: Off the Beaten Path: Dall Sheep 1
programme.desc: Part 1. Greg leaves his front door to embark on a human-powered journey in search of dall sheep. He is faced with paddling one of the Yukon's largest lakes, river crossings, glacier travel, rock climbing the unknowns of what is to come.

programme.title: The Most Wanted List
programme.desc: Uncle Si and the Sicotics take a break from their Nashville recording studio to join Kristy Lee Cook and guide Lee Orr on a wild hog and coyote hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Deadly Passion
programme.desc: Hunting the mountains of Spain for ibex is no small task. Melissa heads in for a late season hunt and is battling not only the difficult terrain, but the temps are frigid and the snow is deep, making this physical hunt even harder.

programme.title: For Love or Likes
programme.sub-title: Insta-Famous Huntress Girl Ready to Compete
programme.desc: Introduction to the girls in the competition. First, the girls struggle to sight in their crossbows with a shooting competition. Then, the girls pick their hunting areas and rush to check trail camera pictures.

programme.title: West of Texas
programme.desc: A lifelong dream awaits Stephen as he ventures to British Columbia in pursuit of a grizzly bear. Accompanying him is hometown friend, Jake Molak, and together they face this unforgiving region head on.

programme.title: The Fierce Life
programme.desc: Fierce team member Devin Archibald travels to the steep and deep canyons of southern New Mexico to hunt Rocky Mountain big horn with Fierce customer, Mark Taylor.

programme.title: The Western Hunter
programme.desc: Part 1. Nate Simmons bowhunts for bull elk prior to the rut in the backcountry of Utah's rugged public lands in search of something special.

programme.title: Into High Country
programme.desc: Part 1. Jason Matzinger chases elk with a bow in his home state of Montana. Hot, dry and smoky conditions make chasing bulls extremely challenging this season.

programme.title: Elk Camp
programme.desc: Steve Chappell guides Mark Long, a hunter who beat the odds and drew a coveted tag to archery elk hunt in Arizona's legendary Unit 9.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Chris Nowak heads up to northern Saskatchewan with a group of friends to hunt giant black bears from the ground. He experiences some ridiculously close encounters and bluff charges.

programme.title: For Love or Likes
programme.sub-title: Insta-Famous Huntress Girl Ready to Compete
programme.desc: Introduction to the girls in the competition. First, the girls struggle to sight in their crossbows with a shooting competition. Then, the girls pick their hunting areas and rush to check trail camera pictures.

programme.title: Under Wild Skies
programme.desc: Tony tours the Blaser Rifles factory in Isny, Germany and designs a custom Safari rifle. He uses it to shoot a Cape buffalo in the Timbavati Game Reserve with professional hunter Jacques Hartzenberg.

programme.title: Handguns And Defensive Weapons
programme.desc: Rich and Jim are joined by SIG Academy instructor Hana Bilodeau to cover the finer points of a successful handgun draw. Rich and Jim debate the merits of retention vs. non-retention holsters.

programme.title: Guns & Gear
programme.desc: Everyday carry options with Ruger's EC9s, SureFire's XH35 weapon light, Sig Sauer's P365 pistol and ammunition, the HLX Collection from Propper, and the M&P .380 Smith & Wesson Shield EZ.

programme.title: Bond Arms
programme.desc: Bond Arms, Special Edition. Old Glory Handgun.

programme.title: Gun Stories
programme.desc: The Uzi is examined.

programme.title: Guns & Ammo TV
programme.desc: Three of the best pro shooters in the country, Rob Leatham, Jerry Miculek and Todd Jarrett, kick off G&A's 60th anniversary series by going head-to-head.

programme.title: Gallery of Guns
programme.desc: The Ruger Security 9, Mossberg 590M, Diamondback DB10P and the Remington 1911 Ultra Lite are displayed. Also: we have shooting tips with G&A editor Eric Poole.

programme.title: Florida Sportsman Project Dreamboat
programme.sub-title: Cuda Rig & Trial; Flea Market Madness
programme.desc: The Cuda Craft receives it's finishing touches in the rigging bay at MCU. FS Boating editor George LaBonte joins the owner of a west coast-style Paramount.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: World Cup
programme.desc: Only on Renegades.

programme.title: Sweden v England
programme.desc: England and Sweden will not need to be told about the significance of their quarter-final in Samara on 7 July. No matter which team advances, it will be hugely significant due to the fact neither side has made it that far at a FIFA World Cup for almost a quarter of a century. For Sweden, if they advance to the semi-finals, it would be the first time since USA 1994, when they finished in third place. As for England, a last-four appearance in Russia would be their first since Italy 1990, when they finished fourth. Sweden are coming off the back of a resilient 1-0 victory over Switzerland thanks to Emil Forsberg's deflected goal. The Three Lions were able to overcome the mental hurdle of conceding a stoppage-time equaliser and defeated Colombia 4-3 on penalties after the match ended 1-1 after extra time, to win the nation's first World Cup finals shootout at the fourth attempt.

programme.title: World Cup
programme.desc: Only on Renegades.

programme.title: World Cup
programme.desc: Only on Renegades.

programme.title: Russia v Croatia
programme.desc: Russia meet Croatia on Saturday in the last match to be played in Sochi at this year's FIFA World Cup. Fisht Stadium has already witnessed some of the most intense and spectacular action of Russia 2018, and the local fans will be hoping to bid a fond farewell to the venue by seeing the hosts advance to the semi-finals. Both teams came through tough battles in the Round of 16, in matches held only a few hours apart. Despite enjoying precious little of the ball against Spain, the Russians fought tooth and nail to protect their goal and eventually prevailed in a penalty shootout. The Croatians were also taken to the wire by Denmark. Following a frenetic start during which both teams scored in the first five minutes, Zlatko Dalic's men were forced to endure a prolonged test of their nerves as the match went into extra time before ultimately prevailing after spot kicks. It remains to be seen which of the two teams recovers from their emotional exertions quickest. The Russians will be looking to draw on every ounce of support that their fervent fans can muster in order to overcome Croatia's individual and collective talent.

Fisht Stadium has already witnessed some of the most intense and spectacular action of Russia 2018, and the local fans will be hoping to bid a fond farewell to the venue by seeing the hosts advance to the semi-finals. Both teams came through tough battles in the Round of 16, in matches held only a few hours apart. Despite enjoying precious little of the ball against Spain, the Russians fought tooth and nail to protect their goal and eventually prevailed in a penalty shootout. The Croatians were also taken to the wire by Denmark. Following a frenetic start during which both teams scored in the first five minutes, Zlatko Dalic's men were forced to endure a prolonged test of their nerves as the match went into extra time before ultimately prevailing after spot kicks. It remains to be seen which of the two teams recovers from their emotional exertions quickest. The Russians will be looking to draw on every ounce of support that their fervent fans can muster in order to overcome Croatia's individual and collective talent.(n)
